hackathon-description-text: Hack K-State is the third annual hackathon at Kansas State University!

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Nintendo Super NES Classic Edition (1 per team member)
Amazon Echo 2 ‑ 2nd Generation (1 per team member)
Amazon Fire TV Stick (1 per team member)
24000mAh Solar Powered Battery Bank (1 per team member)
Logitech G230 Headset (1 per team member)
Dragon Touch Android Tablets (1 per team member)
Amazon Echo Dot - Second Generation (1 per team member)

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Requires the use of the DragonBoard 410c in your hack. 1 per team member.

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How technically impressive was the hack? Was the technical problem the team tackled difficult? Did it use a particularly clever technique or did it use many different components? Did the technology involved make you go “Wow”?

Did the team put thought into the user experience? How well designed is the interface? For a website, this might be about how beautiful the CSS or graphics are. Is it easy to use or does it use a cool interface?
Does the hack work? Did the team achieve everything they wanted?
Did the team stretch themselves? Did they try to learn something new? What kind of projects have they worked on before?

hackathon-description-header: The annual hackathon at Kansas State University
